member.name: T:Windows.Win32.Foundation.HRESULT
member.summary: An HRESULT is a 32-bit status code used in Win32/COM to represent success, failure, or informational results.
member.remarks:
The high-order bit indicates severity (0 = success, 1 = failure). Bits 16-26 encode the facility (origin of the code), and bits 0-15 encode the specific error or status code.
This type is declared in WinNT.h as follows: typedef LONG HRESULT;
